message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the opportunity to purchase this incredible product with you. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll find valuable. I'm willing to offer it to you for $900000. This is a competitive price, and I believe it's a great starting point for our negotiation.

I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I was thinking more along the lines of $750000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and make a serious offer, but I think this product is worth less than what you're asking.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $750000. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my original offer, so I'm counteroffering at $825000. This is a fair price considering the product's value and uniqueness.

I understand your perspective, Alice, but I'm still not convinced that $825000 is a fair price. I'm willing to meet you halfway from your new offer, so I'm counteroffering at $800000. I think this is a more reasonable price considering the product's value.

I understand your persistence, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $800000. I'm willing to make a slight concession, so I'm counteroffering at $815000. This is still a strong price considering the product's value and uniqueness.

I appreciate your willingness to make a concession, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway from your new offer, so I'm counteroffering at $795000. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value and the market demand.

I understand your persistence, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $795000. I'm willing to make another slight concession, so I'm counteroffering at $812500. This is still a strong price considering the product's value and uniqueness.

I appreciate your willingness to make another concession, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway from your new offer, so I'm counteroffering at $790000. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value and the market demand.

I understand your persistence, Bob, but I'm starting to get concerned that we're getting too close to the minimum price I'm willing to accept. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm counteroffering at $807500. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.

I appreciate your willingness to make one more concession, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I've decided to take a step back and re-evaluate my options. I'm willing to walk away from this deal if I don't get a better offer. I'm counteroffering at $780000, and if you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying from John for $1200000.
